titleStmt.title: [An elegy] upon Marsh's one of [the two publick sworn informers against Protestant] religious meetings in the city of London, who [lately dyed very miserably in the prison of] the Counter.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "GO set Scotch Bag-Pipes to the briskest Notes ..."
Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Imperfect: stained, affecting title; portions of title suggested by EAE and OCL in OCLC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
